citation.article-title: Streptococcus halichoeri sp. nov., isolated from grey seals (Halichoerus grypus).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Streptococcus halichoeri sp. nov.
Streptococcus halichoeri (ha.lich.oe′ri. N.L. gen. n. halichoeri of a seal of the genus Halichoerus, systematic genus name of the grey seal).
Cells stain Gram-positive and are cocci that occur in pairs or short chains.
Colonies are white, umbonate, non-haemolytic and 0·5 mm in diameter after 24 h incubation on sheep blood agar.
Using API test kits, acid is produced from cyclodextrin, maltose, mannitol, ribose and pullulan.
Acid may or may not be formed from lactose.
Acid is not produced from l-arabinose, d-arabitol, glycogen, inulin, mannose, melibiose, melezitose, methyl β-d-glucopyranoside, raffinose, sorbitol, starch, sucrose, d-tagatose or trehalose.
Arginine dihydrolase, alkaline phosphatase, alanine phenylalanine proline arylamidase, leucine arylamidase and pyroglutamic acid arylamidase are produced.
Activity is not detected for α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, glycyl trytophan arylamidase, β-mannosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase or urease.
Aesculin and hippurate are not hydrolysed.
The G+C content of its DNA is 39 mol%.
